works.complaint:
I believe these sites are violating Google's policies 

in order to maxmimize the "Search Engine optimization" of their company by
 
linking it to a recent Washington Post Article written about me on July 3,
 
2011.  I am not sure if the violative conduct is called "Deep  
Linking," "Deep Linking Within a Frame,"OR "Trademarked Keyword  
Advertising" [either way, the companies are by linking my name with  
Washington Post to advertise their company with the goal of getting on the
 
first page of google when "Gary T. Fishman" is entered. There is no basis 

for them to link with my name as I am not affilaited with these companies 

in anyway. They are not discussing the content of the articles or
providing  
opinions about its content. They only goal is to link to my name and the  
Post to optimize the advertising of their sites. I have read that this
type  
of conduct is dealt with swiftly at Google. I thank you for your attention
 
to this very important matter.
